svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 7600 DAY CAB and extended cab model with rear pto and some engine options AND 7700 DAY CAB MODEL AFTER MARCH 2005

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 7600 day cab and extended cab model with rear PTO and some engine options and 7700 day cab model after March 2005 contains one air spring (bag) (Item 4), two shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 7). The air suspension assembly (Figure 141) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 12), elbow fitting (Item 11), elbow fitting (Item 30), elbow fitting (Item 31), air spring (bag) (Item 4), height control valve (Item 7), shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) and lateral control rod (Item 3) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 7), air spring (bag) (Item 4) and shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 7, Figure 141) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 142 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Press and hold release collet (Item 1) in against elbow fitting (Item 2) body and pull air line (supply) (Item 3) from elbow fitting in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 4).
Loosen compression nut (Item 5) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 6) from elbow fitting (Item 7) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 4).

Remove height control valve linkage (Item 8) from threaded ball pivot (Item 9) by unlatching linkage clip (Item 10) and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot on height control valve arm (Item 11).

step1.para: Remove two hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 13 and 14) and remove height control valve (Item 7) from mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove driver side shock absorber (Item 5) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 17 and 18) at the top of front shock absorber (Item 5).
Remove hex lock nut (Item 19) at the bottom of driver side shock absorber (Item 5) and remove bushing retainer and rubber bushing (Items 20 and 21) from threaded shaft of driver side shock absorber.
Remove driver side shock absorber (Item 5) with rubber bushing and bushing retainer (Items 21 and 20) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and driver side frame mounting bracket (Item 33 or 34).

step1.para: Remove passenger side shock absorber (Item 6) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 17 and 18) at the top of passenger side shock absorber (Item 6).

Remove hex lock nut (Item 19) at the bottom of passenger side shock absorber (Item 6) and remove bushing retainer and rubber bushing (Items 20 and 21) from threaded shaft of passenger side shock absorber.

Remove passenger side shock absorber (Item 6) with rubber bushing and bushing retainer (Items 21 and 20) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and passenger side frame mounting bracket (Item 33 or 34).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Loosen compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 11) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 12) from elbow fitting at bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 4).
Unthread elbow fitting (Item 11) from bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 4).
Using a screwdriver, pry retaining ring (Item 28) from bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 4).

note.para: Prying the retaining ring from the bottom of the air spring (bag) will damage it, a new retaining ring will be supplied with the new air spring (Bag).

step2.para: Unthread top of air spring (bag) (Item 4) from threaded stud (Item 24) of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Compress air spring (bag) (Item 4) and slide it from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Lateral Control Rod

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove lateral control rod (Item 3) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 22) and hex lock nut (Item 23) from lateral control rod mount (Item 25) of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and lateral control rod (Item 3).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 22) and hex lock nut (Item 23) from cab mounting plate (Item 1) and lateral control rod (Item 3) and remove lateral control rod.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Jounce Bumper
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 141 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 15) and hex lock nut (Item 16) from jounce bumper (Item 10).
Remove jounce bumper (Item 10) from underneath cab mounting plate (Item 1).
